researchers_stance: V2 crossed the 50% conversion threshold (67%) with targeted changes responding to V1's data. The forward-looking reframe tripled fomo_scroller conversion (17%→50%). The referral incentive and free social activity closed the social_connector gap. journal_graveyard doubled (17%→42%) but 25% dealbreakers persist — these are structural. The page is getting long, which matters for mobile traffic. Trimming is the V3 priority.
exec_summary: Targeted V1's two biggest gaps: added forward-looking discovery angle for fomo_scroller and retention section for journal_graveyard. Also added referral incentive, free friend activity, and cold-start paragraph. Conversion hit 67%, crossing the 50% threshold. All buckets improved. Page length is a new concern.
findings:
• Forward-looking reframe tripled fomo_scroller: 17% → 50% conversion. 'Discover what's next' in the hero subhead was the single highest-leverage change.
  • Referral incentive closed social_connector gap: 50% → 75% conversion, 0% dealbreakers. 'Invite 3 friends → free Pro month' aligned business model with product growth.
  • Retention section moved journal_graveyard: 17% → 42%. 'Most apps die after a week. We know that.' earned trust through honesty.
  • city_explorer hit 92%: Cold-start paragraph ('first it's your map') resolved their primary concern.
  • Page length concern emerging: Multiple personas mention mobile reading experience. V3 should trim ~20%.
recommendations:
1. Trim ~20% of page length: Protect conversion-driving content, cut supporting detail. Priority: tighten problem section, shorten cold-start explanation.
  2. Add annual pricing: 4+ personas requested $99/year option.
  3. Specify taste analytics: Replace vague 'taste analytics' with concrete descriptions.
  4. Monitor network believability dip: -7pp from V1. May be noise, may be dilution from longer page.
qualitative_themes:
• 'Choosing feels like work' is a new anchor line (5 mentions): Added in V2, immediately resonates with fomo_scroller.
  • 'First it's your map' is the city_explorer anchor (7 mentions): Most-cited line overall. Solo→social journey in one sentence.
  • Honesty about retention earns trust (4 mentions): journal_graveyard specifically responds to 'we know apps die after a week.'
  • Page length concern (8 mentions): 'Getting long for mobile.' Especially from fomo_scroller and city_explorer (action-oriented).
  • Objections shifting to product-level (6 mentions): 'I need to see the interface' — healthy signal that copy is approaching its ceiling.
clarity_notes: 100% nailed_it. Perfect clarity. The product is fully understood by all 60 personas.
appendix_notes: Same audience (audience_v1.json). All deltas directly comparable to V1 and baseline.

bucket_deep_dives.taste_curator:
75% conversion (+17pp)

Steady improvement. 83% resonance shows strong connection. Taste analytics vagueness is the remaining friction.

Key personas: Want specifics: 'which neighborhoods, which categories.'

Risk: Removing the specific examples would hurt this bucket.
bucket_deep_dives.social_connector:
75% conversion (+25pp), 0% dealbreakers

Referral incentive + free social tier was the unlock. Resonance-conversion gap from V1 is closed. Objections are now product-level only.

Key personas: Ready to evangelize. 'I'd have 3 friends on this within a week.'

Risk: None from copy. Product invite flow quality is the remaining variable.
bucket_deep_dives.journal_graveyard:
42% conversion (+25pp), 25% dealbreakers

Doubled but dealbreakers are structural. No passive tracking = guaranteed eventual abandonment for some personas.

Key personas: 'The honesty earned my try. Whether I stick with it is on me.'

Risk: 25% dealbreaker floor may be structural. Copy can't solve behavior change.
bucket_deep_dives.fomo_scroller:
50% conversion (+33pp) — biggest single-round gain

Forward-looking reframe was the exact right change. 'V1 told me to record my life. V2 tells me to upgrade it.'

Key personas: Discovery-driven. They want Saturday plans, not Monday journals.

Risk: Page length is hurting this mobile-first audience.
bucket_deep_dives.city_explorer:
92% conversion (+17pp) — near ceiling

11 of 12 personas would convert. Cold-start paragraph was the final piece.

Key personas: 'The page addresses my situation perfectly without naming it specifically.'

Risk: Community discovery beyond friends is the remaining product request.
